name: sdxl-inpainting-editor
title: SDXL Inpainting and Object Removal
description: Seamlessly remove or replace objects in images using SDXL inpainting capabilities.
extendedDescription: Master the art of image editing with this SDXL inpainting workflow. Remove unwanted objects, replace backgrounds, or add new elements to your photos with stunning precision. The workflow uses SDXL's inpainting model to understand context and generate seamless replacements that blend naturally with the surrounding image. Ideal for photographers, designers, and content creators.
howToUse: Load your image into the workflow
Use the mask editor to select the area to modify
Enter a prompt describing what should appear in the masked area
Adjust denoising strength (0.7-0.9 for replacements, 0.3-0.5 for subtle edits)
metaDescription: Remove objects and edit images with SDXL inpainting in ComfyUI. Free workflow template for professional image editing.

faqItems.question: What's the difference between inpainting and outpainting?
faqItems.answer: Inpainting modifies content within your image boundaries, while outpainting extends the image beyond its original borders.

faqItems.question: Why do my edits look blurry?
faqItems.answer: Try increasing the denoising strength or using a higher resolution. Also ensure your mask edges are clean.
